results.question: The Tiananmen Square protests of 1989 were held in Hong Kong.
The first televised presidential debate was between Jimmy Carter and Gerald Ford.
The Spitfire originated from a racing plane.
The M41 Walker Bulldog remains in service in some countries to this day.
"I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it" is a quote from French philosopher Voltaire.
The United States was a member of the League of Nations.
United States President Ronald Reagan was the first president to appoint a woman to the Supreme Court.
Adolf Hitler was accepted into the Vienna Academy of Fine Arts.
Kublai Khan is the grandchild of Genghis Khan?
Thomas Crapper was a plumber who invented the flushing toilet.
